content: row 10 k2 2 sts for the ties do i-cord on 2 stitches for 5 inches *note the hat made for this pattern is for a smaller toad that i made using 2 mm needles for making the hat for a regular toad made with 2 5 mm needles do the i-cord for 6 inches instead after 5 inches fasten_off yarn by threading it through last 2 stitches and knotting the ends for the right side of the hat also while holding the hat upside down find the front of the hat and pick up and knit 5 stitches about 10 stitches away from the other side piece front of hat is now facing you then follow row 1-10 same as for the left side of the hat and do the same i-cord tie when hat is completed weave and tuck all remaining yarn ends inside the hat finished hat should look like figs 4 and 5 front side fig 4 fig 5 © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 5 now i like to stretch the bottom part of the hat out more by adding a bit more stuffing to the yarn ends that are already tucked in there if you prefer a thinner hat though you can just skip this part next i cut out a circular piece of cardboard i just use a leftover piece of toilet paper roll and glue it inside the hat to the stuffing see fig 6 once that s done i sew on the elf ears to each hat side near to where the i-cord starts see fig 7 fig 6 fig 7 all that s left to do now is if you like to add a little blush to the inside of the ear with a q-tip and to sew on your jingle bell to the end of the hat see fig 8 fig 8 © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 6 then try it on your toad i do so hope you enjoyed making your little toad elf hat if you
